intro: Boerhavia sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bluestem, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a perennial herb with upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are sessile, meaning they are attached directly to the stem without a stalk. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots that allow it to survive in poor soils. Boerhavia sessiliflora plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitats.
